author: max_patrick_hamon
post: To David Goulet, it is far from proven that Luke was a physician (“doctor”). Reminder: Luke in Greek is Loukas and Lucius in Latin, from the verb luceo, lucere, “to shine”. Yaïr is the Hebrew for Luke/Loukas/Lucius and Yaïr is transcripted Iairos in Greek, which is very close to Iatros. Now in Greek the cursive “t” can easily be mistaken for a cursive “i” and iairos turn into iatros, “physician”. Actually, no Biblical scholar worth his/her salt can tell for sure whether or not iatros is just a mistranscription in Greek of the Hebrew given name Yaïr..
